meanings.definition: An instrument for measuring acceleration, typically in a vehicle or electronic device.
meanings.sent1: The accelerometer in the car showed how fast it was speeding up.
meanings.sent2: The smartphone's accelerometer helps in detecting motion.
meanings.sent3: The accelerometer in the spaceship went on strike, refusing to measure any more speed.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like an accelerometer, constantly measuring her increasing happiness.
meanings.sent5: The accelerometer beeped loudly as the roller coaster accelerated down the track.

meanings.definition: A device that measures the rate of change of velocity.
meanings.sent1: The accelerometer on the rocket recorded the speed changes during launch.
meanings.sent2: The fitness tracker uses an accelerometer to monitor your movement.
meanings.sent3: The accelerometer and the speedometer had a race to see who could measure velocity changes faster.
meanings.sent4: His heart was like an accelerometer, constantly adjusting to the ups and downs of life.
meanings.sent5: The accelerometer displayed the sudden drop in speed as the elevator came to a halt.
